summary: The 'Better Care For Domestic Violence Survivors Act' aims to amend the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994. It establishes a demonstration program to provide trauma-informed, victim-centered training for healthcare providers and other covered individuals to better assist survivors of domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault, and stalking. The bill authorizes grants for eligible entities to implement the program, develop collaborative relationships, and evaluate the effectiveness of the training. It also includes provisions for identifying existing training programs and requiring evaluations. Appropriations of $10 million annually from 2026-2030 are authorized.
